activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Teagon M. Simplot

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.

03:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Defense argues for bond modification, State objects. Court denies bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Teagon M. Simplot appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Teagon M. Simplot. Court modifies bond conditions to correct victim initials: No contact directly or indirectly with victims T.K, or A.A.Z., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  No contact with Del Mae Motel. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom, waiving time limits. Preliminary Hearing scheduled August 1, 2022 at 10:30 AM.
No contact directly or indirectly with victims T.K, or A.A.Z., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  No contact with Del Mae Motel.

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified.
